docs.snippet: BRUSSELS, Jan. 1 — Romania and Bulgaria joined the European Union today, helping to end geographic divisions left over from the cold war and extending the borders of the now 27-member bloc eastward to the Black Sea.

docs.snippet: One person was found dead after a fire tore through a third-floor apartment last night, the authorities said. The victim, who was too badly burned to be immediately identified, was found in an apartment building on Manor Drive, south of Ivy Hill...
docs.lead_paragraph: One person was found dead after a fire tore through a third-floor apartment last night, the authorities said. The victim, who was too badly burned to be immediately identified, was found in an apartment building on Manor Drive, south of Ivy Hill Park, said John Brown, a Fire Department spokesman. The one-alarm fire apparently started sometime before 10:30 p.m. in the bedroom, Chief Michael Lalor said. The cause was still being investigated.

headline.main: Newark: One Is Killed in Fire
headline.print_headline: Newark: One Is Killed in Fire

docs.snippet: A man suffered burns from his chin to his nose while he was on an operating table on Nov. 29, and the cause of the fire is still unknown, The Waterbury Republican-American reported yesterday, citing a new report from the city’s acting fire...
docs.lead_paragraph: A man suffered burns from his chin to his nose while he was on an operating table on Nov. 29, and the cause of the fire is still unknown, The Waterbury Republican-American reported yesterday, citing a new report from the city’s acting fire marshal. The patient, Jose Adorno, 60, of Waterbury, was burned at Waterbury Hospital. Hospital officials have said a piece of equipment malfunctioned and caused a flash fire. Chet Bennett, the acting fire marshal, told The Republican-American that the department was unable to determine a cause because the room had been cleaned after the fire.
docs.nytddes: Medicine and Health; Hospitals; Fires and Firefighters

docs.snippet: New Jersey Transit wants to create a joint agreement with Amtrak to dispatch trains along the Northeast Corridor, with the goal of reducing delays that it says are caused by Amtrak. Amtrak owns the tracks used by New Jersey Transit between Trenton...
docs.lead_paragraph: New Jersey Transit wants to create a joint agreement with Amtrak to dispatch trains along the Northeast Corridor, with the goal of reducing delays that it says are caused by Amtrak. Amtrak owns the tracks used by New Jersey Transit between Trenton and New York. New Jersey Transit is seeking more control over train assignments, The Sunday Record of Bergen County reported yesterday, citing a New Jersey Transit spokesman.

docs.snippet: Two people were killed and another person was seriously injured after a sport utility vehicle slammed into a sedan on Route 1 and 9 yesterday evening, the police said. They did not identify the victims, but said the two people killed had been in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Two people were killed and another person was seriously injured after a sport utility vehicle slammed into a sedan on Route 1 and 9 yesterday evening, the police said. They did not identify the victims, but said the two people killed had been in the same car, a red Ford Fusion. According to a witness, a woman walked out of the Days Inn at 2750 Tonnelle Avenue about 6 p.m. and got into the driver’s seat of the Ford. She left the motel’s driveway and tried to cut across the northbound lane of Route 1 and 9, but a Dodge Durango plowed into her car, causing serious damage to the driver’s side, said Amir Kadri, 26, a witness. The driver of the Dodge, a man, was taken to Jersey City Medical Center in serious condition, the police said.

headline.main: North Bergen, N.J.: 2 People Killed in Collision
headline.print_headline: North Bergen: 2 People Killed in Collision
